reporting-org.narrative: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs

title.narrative: Multi- sectorial response on child protection and SGBV services for 370 boys , girls and adolecents at medium to high risk (Direct target 370 ) Refugees from Palestine and Syria in South: 4 camps and 6 gatherings , in Ain El helwi camp , in Saida,Bourjchamali , Rashidieh and Al Bass camp in Tyre ( 6 gatherings in Tyre are Maachouk,Jelelbahar , Qasmiye,Wasta , Shabreeha and Bourghlieh) In addition, to two palestinian camps in Beirut and Mount Lebanon that are Shateel and BourjBarajneh.

description.narrative:
The project aims at providing child protection response services to the children at medium to high risk living in the Palestinian refugee camp of South Lebanon Tyre (Al Bass, Borj El Chamali and Rashidye) and Saida ( Ain ElHelwi and Mieh WMieh ), Beirut and Mount Lebanon(BourjBarajneh and Shateela) . The project will also target girls and boys who will be provided with SGBV services. In addition, the project will propose a comprehensive package of services to the children and their families. The response to the needs will be done through the main following actions: - Providing case management service for 150 children who are at medium to high risk of Child spouse, Child parent, unaccompanied child, Child with special education needs, Unaccompanied ,separated child not under the care of either parent , other legal or customary primary caregiver, children under violence abuse and neglect identified through outreach teams and referrals, with case management, provision of services (focused PSS, and/or referral to specialized services) - Providing focused PSS to 300 children at medium to high risk - Providing 70 SGBV case management for girls and adolecents at medium to high risk - Supporting capacity building of local partners (Technical and organizational) In alignment with the Child protection minimum standards, this project will prioritize local ownership of Child Protection (CP) interventions and contribute to preventing and responding to CP concerns, including SGBV, disability and Lebanese CM SOPs and Focused PSS to foster individuals’ and communities’ resilience.
TDH L is proposing a new modality of intervention that will use a twofold approach: In Saida , Beirut and Mount Lebanon camps, TDH L will directly implement the activities with children at high risk as this is a new area of intervention and the level of need will require a strong expertise. The two identified partners ( Nabaa in Saida and Mousawaat in Beirut and Mount Lebanon will implement case management and focused PSS with children at medium risk with closed follow up , support and coach by TDHL staff. It is also to be noted that there are no child protection actor in this area (Ain el Helwe) . In addition, TDH L is already working with partner in Tyre area,PWHO (Program Women Health Organization). PWHO benefited from trainings and capacity buildings that allow them now to manage high risk cases. Their capacities have significantly increased and for example, they are now using the Child Protection Information Management System. TDHL will directly manage 50 high risk cases and implementing focused PSS for 100 children in Saida ( Ain El helwi and Beiru ( Shateel and Bourjbarajneh ), In addition to directly manage 70 cases( include 80 % girls and adolescent and 20 % boys) at medium to risk of SGBv in South , Beirut and Mount Lebanon. The local partners PWHO in Tyre ( Bourjchamali , AlBass and Rashidieh in addition to 6 gatherings ) will manage 50 medium and high risk cases and and implement focused PSS activities with 100 children at medium to high risk included the 50 children in case management. The local partners NABAA in Saida ( Ain Elhelwi camp ) will manage 25 medium risk cases and and implement focused PSS activities with 50 children at medium to high risk included the 25 children in case management. The local partners Mosawaat in Beirut and Mount Lebanon ( Shateela and BourjBarajneh camps ) will manage 25 medium risk cases and and implement focused PSS activities with 50 children at medium to high risk included the 25 children in case management. TDH L will continue building the capacity of PWHO, MOUSAWAT and Nabaa in order to prepare a transition for a further phase of project. In the same time, TDH L will take in charge the SGBV case management activities for children at medium to high risk in all areas ( South , Beirut and Mount Lebanon camps.)
